title: Installation issue: autoconf can reach max shebang limit and break install
body:
<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

I ran into this when my install_tree was set to a very long path (110 characters). I think an install_tree of 108 characters is the maximum allowed or autoconf will break. This can be fixed by using a shorter path for the install_tree, but I want to post this here if anyone else hits the same problem. 

install_tree: `/yellow/usr/projects/paraview/stam/pilotlight/tests/spack/tmp_grizzly_master_intel_19.0.4.243/spack/opt/spack`

For autoconf, this path is used in the shebang line to point at spack's `sbang`:
```console
$ head -n 1 /yellow/usr/projects/paraview/stam/pilotlight/tests/spack/tmp_grizzly_master_intel_19.0.4.243/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-broadwell/intel-19.0.4.243/autoconf-2.69-zqfhovvstutdvl6cbu3omtpmep26246u/bin/autom4te 
#!/bin/sh /yellow/usr/projects/paraview/stam/pilotlight/tests/spack/tmp_grizzly_master_intel_19.0.4.243/spack/opt/spack/bin/sbang
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ # set spack's install tree to a path with more than 108 characters
$ spack install automake@1.16.2
...

==> Fetching file:///usr/projects/paraview/stam/pilotlight/tests/spack/tmp_grizzly_master_intel_19.0.4.243/local_mirror/_source-cache/archive/b2/b2f361094b410b4acbf4efba7337bdb786335ca09eb2518635a09fb7319ca5c1.tar.gz
==> automake: Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> automake: Executing phase: 'configure'
==> [2020-12-22-08:51:16.789896] '/tmp/stam/spack-stage/spack-stage-automake-1.16.2-pslgvilp55qardyui3jvqjobdwzji324/spack-src/configure' '--prefix=/yellow/usr/projects/paraview/stam/pilotlight/tests/spack/tmp_grizzly_master_intel_19.0.4.243/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-broadwell/intel-19.0.4.243/automake-1.16.2-pslgvilp55qardyui3jvqjobdwzji324'
checking whether make supports nested variables... yes
checking build system type... x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
checking host system type... x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
checking for a BSD-compatible install... /usr/bin/install -c
checking whether build environment is sane... yes
checking for a race-free mkdir -p... /usr/bin/mkdir -p
checking for gawk... gawk
checking whether make sets $(MAKE)... yes

checking for tex... tex
checking for yacc... yacc
checking for lex... lex
checking whether autoconf is installed... yes
checking whether autoconf works... no
configure: error: The installed version of autoconf does not work.
    Please check config.log for error messages before this one.
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/tmp/stam/spack-stage/spack-stage-automake-1.16.2-pslgvilp55qardyui3jvqjobdwzji324/spack-src/configure' '--prefix=/yellow/usr/projects/paraview/stam/pilotlight/tests/spack/tmp_grizzly_master_intel_19.0.4.243/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-broadwell/intel-19.0.4.243/automake-1.16.2-pslgvilp55qardyui3jvqjobdwzji324'
```

Autoconf fails at:
```console
$ autoconf ./configtest.ac
/bin/sh: /yellow/usr/projects/paraview/stam/pilotlight/tests/spack/tmp_grizzly_master_intel_19.0.4.243/spack/opt/spack/bin/sba: No such file or directory
```
